FuncDef:
The remote address command assigns an IP address to the peer.
The undo remote address command deletes the IP address assigned to the peer.
By default, no IP address is assigned to the peer.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an IP address assigned to the peer.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If Devices are connected through PPP links, interfaces of the client can obtain IP addresses from the server through negotiation. This is applicable to the scenario where the client accesses the Internet by connecting to the Internet Service Provider (ISP) device through PPP links (for example through dial-up). In this case, the ISP device assigns an IP address to the client through negotiation.
The remote address command is used on the server to assign an IP address to the interface of the client.
Prerequisites
The client and the server have been directly connected either physically or Layer 2 logically.
PPP has been configured as the link layer protocol of the interface.
Configuration Impact
If the remote address command is run more than once, the latest configuration overrides the previous one. After the configuration, the client is assigned a new IP address.
Precautions
The IP address or the address pool to be assigned to the peer cannot conflict with the IP addresses of the local Device.
The function of automatically obtaining IP addresses through negotiation is applicable to only PPP interfaces.
After the configuration, you must run the shutdown, commit, and undo shutdown commands in the corresponding interface view for the configuration to take effect.
